doss

Interface BlobTx

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Named
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalBlobTx

    public interface BlobTx
extends Named, AutoCloseable
    A transaction for writing to a BlobStore.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commit()
      Commits the transaction, ensuring all blobs written in this transaction are persisted in permanent storage.
      void prepare()
      Ensure all data has hit disk and the transaction can be committed without error.
      Blob put(byte[] bytes)
      Store the contents of a byte array as a new blob.
      Blob put(Path source)
      Store a local file as a new blob.
      Blob put(String contents)
      Store the contents of a string as a new blob.
      Blob put(Writable output)
      Store a new blob.
      void rollback()
      Rolls back transaction, purging any newly written objects.

      • put

        Blob put(String contents)
         throws IOException
        Store the contents of a string as a new blob. The String will be encoded with UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        source - contents to store
        Returns:
        the new blob
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • commit

        void commit()
            throws IOException
        Commits the transaction, ensuring all blobs written in this transaction are persisted in permanent storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • rollback

        void rollback()
              throws IOException
        Rolls back transaction, purging any newly written objects.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • prepare

        void prepare()
        Ensure all data has hit disk and the transaction can be committed without error. Used in two-phase commit. Note: Once a transaction has been prepared it will not automatically be committed or rolled-back. It MUST be explicitly rolled-back or committed. Applications can recover lost transactions using BlobStore.recover()
